Name: Amending the definitions of sexual orientation and gender in the New York city human rights law.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to amending the definitions of sexual orientation and gender in the New York city human rights law

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Rights
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
This Introduction was Amended by Committee
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was Hearing Scheduled by Mayor
History.MinutesNote: This bill was noticed but did not have a Mayoral public hearing on 12-18-2017

History.Description: This Introduction was City Charter Rule Adopted
History.MinutesNote: This bill was returned unsigned on Jan. 17, 2018 (31st Day, Jan. 11, 2018).

History.Description: This Introduction was Returned Unsigned by Mayor

Attachments.Name: May 25, 2016 - Stated Meeting Agenda with Links to Files
December 11, 2017 - Stated Meeting Agenda with Links to Files
Legislative Documents - Letter to the Mayor
Minutes of the Stated Meeting - December 11, 2017

Summary: This bill would amend the definitions for sexual orientation and gender in the New York City Human Rights Law.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      Section 1.  Subdivision 20 of section 8-102 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by local law number 39 for the year 1991, is amended to read as follows:   
	20. The term "sexual orientation" means an individual's actual or perceived romantic, physical or sexual attraction to other persons, or lack thereof, on the basis of gender. A continuum of sexual orientation exists and includes, but is not limited to, heterosexuality, homosexuality, [or] bisexuality, asexuality, and pansexuality.
	� 2.  Subdivision 23 of section 8-102 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by local law number 3 for the year 2002, is amended to read as follows:  
      23. The term "gender" shall include actual or perceived sex [and shall also  include  a  person's  gender  identity,  self-image, appearance, behavior or expression, whether or not that gender identity, self-image, appearance, behavior or expression is different from that traditionally associated with the legal], gender identity, and gender expression including a person's actual or perceived gender-related self-image, appearance, behavior, expression, or other gender-related characteristic, regardless of the sex assigned to that person at birth.	
	� 3.  This local law takes effect 120 days after it becomes law. 

LS #5628
DA/ZH
12/01/2017
